Description: Construction of a new labour and delivery unit, new neo-natal intensive care unit and level II nurseries, as well as rebuilt antenatal and post-natal units, support service areas and expanded ambulatory care space.
Fit-up of two 20-bed inpatient units on the 7th and 8th floors to address needs for negative pressure and isolation inpatient rooms.

Project: St. Joseph's Healthcare (Toronto) - Phase 3 and 4 Redevelopment
Description: This project is the final phase of new construction and renovations to modernize outdated facilities for maternal/newborn service
Result: Addition of 2 surgical inpatient units, increased  capacity for an up to 6-bed child/adolescent mental health unit, and additional capacity for an up to 28-bed medical unit.

Description: Leasehold improvements to support the relocation of the CHC.
Replace the roof membrane at 955 Queen St East, Toronto.

Project: Humber River Hospital - Reactivation Care Centre
Description: Reactivation of Humber River Hospital's Church site to open inpatient bed capacity to accommodate alternate level of care patients for various hospitals in the Greater Toronto Area.

Project: Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre - Brain Sciences Centre
Description: Construction of a new, 3-storey, 121,000 sq.ft  building and 4,700 sq.ft. of renovations in the existing F wing.
Result: Expanded adult and youth mental health programs and services.

Project: Mackenzie Health - New Vaughan Hospital (formerly York Central Hospital)
Description: Construction of a new hospital to be located in Vaughan and to become the second site of a two-site hospital model for Mackenzie Health
Result: Expanded services (e.g. acute inpatient and intensive care beds, emergency, surgical, and surgery, diagnostic imaging services) and fully integrated smart technology (first of its kind in Canada)

Project: North Wellington Health Care Corporation - ER/Ambulatory Care Project
Description: Renovations to the Emergency Room and Ambulatory Care areas at the Louise Marshall Hospital Site in Mount Forest
Result: Increased level of service at the emergency department and ambulatory care areas at the Louise Marshall Hospital Site in Mount Forest.

Project: Water Supply Feasibility Study and Design for Community Lot Servicing
Description: Feasibility and design planning to improve water capacity and water supply services to a populated area of the First Nation.
Result: Increased water distribution capacity for the surrounding area and a more effective water distribution system.

Project: Wastewater Feasibility Study for Community Lot Servicing
Description: Feasibility and design planning for a gravity wastewater sewer system on Scott Road.
Result: Improved capacity of the wastewater sewer system.

Description: Drainage studies on surface flooding problem areas of the First Nation,.
Result: Improved drainage and reduced standing water problems.

Project: Ditch, Swale and Berm Rehabilitation for Lot servicing
Description: Rehabilitation of the existing stormwater system, including ditch, swale and berm components.
Result: Extended life span for the stormwater conveyance system.

Project: To connect the Loretto area and Weca area water systems in the Township of Adjala Township
Description: Connect the Loretto area and Weca area water systems.
Result: Increased redundancy to the Loretto water system.
Address: South of Simcoe County Road 50 and Simcoe County Road 1 in the Township of Adjala Township, Loretto, ON L0G 1L0

Project: Replacement of Dillabough Road Stormwater Culvert
Description: This project will include the replacement of an existing Stormwater Culvert which was due for replacement as part of the road repair due in 2016 according to our Asset Management Plan. Replacement of this culvert will contribute to the prolongation of the life of the road by keeping water off, out of, and away from the road. This project will assist the Township in maintaining our rural stormwater system through culverts, ditches, slope and road design which will reduce the impacts of water running off of land during storm events. The environmental impact of additional runoff can erode watercourses as well as cause flooding after the stormwater collection system is overwhelmed by the additional flow and cause pollutants to enter surface waters during precipitation events.
Result: Prolonged lifespan of the road, and reduced environmental impact.

Project: Conduct Condition Assessment on Six Stormwater Management Ponds
Description: Assess the condition of 6 stormwater management ponds at  Ponds # 7, 17, 18, 27, 33 and 50.
Result: Established priorities for future maintenance work.

Project: Steele Valley stormwater management pond rehabilitation and repair.
Description: Alterations to the outlet structure that manages stormwater discharge to Millers Creek during peak storm events,  repair to the access road, installation of a new chain gate and removal of sediment off site.
Result: Maintain the existing wetland and wildlife habitat and prevent localized flooding and erosion issues on Millers Creek.

Project: Storm sewer outfall rehabilitation at Spiers Crescent
Description: Install an oil/grit separator, and structural repair of the existing storm sewer outfall at Spiers Crescent.
Result: Improved water quality discharged to a large wetland and ultimately to Carruthers Creek.

Description: Design and construct a solution to the improve the quality of the stormwater being discharged into Dufferin Creek.

Project: Installation of an Oil/ Grit Separator
Description: Installation an oil/grit separator upstream of the storm sewer outfall at Callander Court.
Result: Improved water quality treatment for approximately 2 hectares of residential stormwater runoff and conformity with treatment standards.

Project: Installation of an Oil/ Grit Separator
Description: Installation an oil/grit separator upstream of the storm sewer outfall at Caldicott Court.
Result: Improved water quality treatment for approximately 2 hectares of residential stormwater runoff and conformity with treatment standards.

Description: Rehabilitate and repair the Hermitage Stormwater Management Pond.
Result: Significant improvements the a stormwater facility and prevention of basement flooding during storm events.

Project: Fishlock and Heritage Market stormwater management pond rehabilitation.
Description: Repair and rehabilitate two stormwater management  ponds.
Result: This project will help maintain the existing wetland and wildlife habitat and prevent localized flooding and erosion issues on Millers Creek and Carruthers Creek, respectively.

Description: Decommissioning 11 bored/dugwells and 2 drilled wells.
Result: Improved safe operations and reduced isk of environmental contamination.

Project: Replacement of Dainage Culverts on  Dawson Road

Replace the culvert on Kokomis Road.
Result: Improved drainage and increased environmental protection of the Bonnechere River.

Result: Reduced meter reading costs and improved water conservation.

Description: Install new forcemain pipes along Country Road 20, upgrade Pump Station No. 22 and decommission the Edgewater wastewater lagoons

Description: Replace the supervisory control and data acquisition  system, and replace the ozone generators and controllers.

Description: Inspect 18 kilometers of wastewater mains to identify priority rehabilitation needs.

Description: Update the planning  studies and master plan for stormwater, wastewater collection and treatment, water storage, distribution and supply.

Result: Enable the water to flow into the storm water system which will stop oil and contaminants from entering Georgian Bay.

Description: Replacement of failed Beausoleil First Nation septic systems at various locations within the community.
Result: Ensure that untreated wastewater does not enter the environment and negatively impact surrounding communities.

Description: Install new sanitary sewers and storm sewers and  upgrade of the watermain on South Park Street.
Result: Reduction in effluent released in to the environment and an improved water quality of the Bay of Quinte.

Description: Replace the watermain, sanitary sewer repairs and reconstruct the road including the storm sewers on Cedar and Henry Street.
Result: Fewer water quality issues experienced  on Cedar St. from Catharine St. to Moira St. West.

Description: Replace 8 individual septic systems (tank and field) which have exceeded their design life.
Result: Proper treatment of waste, prevent backups of raw sewage back into the homes, and reduced  contamination in nearby environment.

Description: Replace the water plant's control system.
Rehabilitation of sanitary sewers, water main, hydrants, valves, and surface drainage works and roadway restoration.

Project: Bayfield Wastewater System Inflow and Infiltration Study

Description: Conduct an environmental assessment for the replacement of the Hensall water tower.

Project: Upgrades to the Standpipe Water Storage Tower
Description: Install a chlorine mixing system within the storage tank and  repair and replace the coatings of the interior and the exterior.
Result: Improved water quality for 530 users in the Village of Eganville.

Description: Relocate the drainage on Eight Street with a combination of open ditches, culverts and storm sewers, eventually discharging to the existing roadside ditch on Fredrick Street.

Result: The outcomes of the investigation will be used to refine the design of the flood mitigation infrastructure work.

Description: Undertake an assessment of all of the existing storm sewers within the area utilizing the latest technologies to locate, assess the condition and inventory the network.
Result: Enhance coordination efforts by the City of Brampton and the Region of Peel on infrastructure projects.

Description: Upgrade the outdated dry pond stormwater management facility to a wet pond facility.

Description: Construct a new pond outfall structure and outlet channel.
Result: Reduced safety hazard due to the deteriorating outfall at drinkwater pond.

Project: Study and Mitigation of the Thermal Effects of Stormwater.

Project: Rehabilitation of Streambanks Within the Etibicoke Creek Watershed

Description: Design, tender, and construction for sediment removal and/or structural repairs to restore capacity and function of the stormwater pond.

Description: Install a second 200mm diameter wastewater siphon to provide redundancy/security for the siphon crossing.

Description: Upgrade 1,186 meters of existing  sanitary sewer on Greenwich Drive.

Description: Preliminary engineering work for a water master plan for Beaverton, Cannington and Sunderland.

Project: Replacement of Existing Primary Digester Roof

Description: Replace all the underground infrastructure, including sanitary sewers, storm sewers, and watermains as part of the reconstruction of Bartholomew Street from Pearl Street to the CN Railway tracks.

Project: Reconstruction of the city's main sewage pumping station.

Project: Assessment of the City's Main Sewage Pumping Station's Forcemain

Project: Upgrade/Replace the Sewage Treatment Plant Aeration Equipment

Description: Replace the backup generator  at the Wastewater Plant.

Description: Replace aging, corroded piping, guide rails, refurbish the pumps, inspect and repair any cement cracks or deterioration
Result: Extend the useful life of the wastewater pump station.

Description: Replace aging, corroded piping, guide rails, refurbish the pumps, inspect and repair any cement cracks or deterioration

Description: Build two stormwater ditches  along Guiney Road where none exists to divert stormwater.

The new facility will provide better access to culturally appropriate spaces for the local urban Indigenous population and surrounding rural First Nations communities. The cultural facility is intended to serve as a Centre of Excellence, promote Anishinaabe culture, and help to advance the Calls to Action put forward by the Truth and Reconciliation Commission.
