Result: Increased operating flexibility and safety.

Description: Complete rehabilitation of the water reservoir, including a complete relining of the tank and the installation of up-to-date equipment.
Result: Provide a safe source of drinking water to the residents located in the Michipicoten River Village.

Description: Install a new dechlorinator at the water reservoir.

Project: Study  to identify actions necessary to address Trihalomethane in drinking water
Description: Complete a full study  to identify actions necessary to address trihalomethane in drinking water.

Project: Back Up Generator for the Wastewater Treatment Facility
Description: Replace the faulty back-up generator.
Result: Prevented untreated wastewater from entering the environment and negatively impacting surrounding communities.

Description: Construct 665 meters of storm sewers to separate the current combined sewer system in the River Rd area (Dorothy St, Evan St, and Margery Rd).
Result: Reduce/eliminate sewer overflows that go directly to the Welland River.

Description: Replace approximately 665 meters of old cast iron watermains on Dorothy St, Evan St, and Margery Rd.
Result: Improved water quality and fire flows to 83 residential properties.

Project: Arthur Wastewater Treatment Plant Upgrade - Detailed Design
Description: Prepare detailed engineering design of treatment plant upgrade at the Arthur wastewater treatment plant.
Replace the standby generator along with  its fuel supply, upgrade the supervisory control and data acquisition system, and replace the lagoon decant system.
Result: Extended life for the 40-year old Rodney sewage system.

Description: Replace the chlorine disinfection system  at Durham Wastewater Treatment Plant with an ultraviolet system.
Result: Reduced chemical discharge to the Saugeen River and meet the provincial and federal requirements.

Project: Station Street Lateral Assessments and Pipe Rehabilitation
Description: Construct and install a structural liner, grouting, and miscellaneous service repair from Hornak Rd to Forest Ave.

Project: Replace and upgrade Thompson Road sanitary sewer
Description: Replace the Polyvinyl chloride pipe on Thompson Ro from manhole #200 to manhole #201.
Result: Additional growth capacity in the industrial park.

Project: Colver St. and Wade Rd. Lateral Assessments and Pipe Rehabilitation
Description: Construct and install a structural liner, grouting,  as well as  make miscellaneous service repairs on  Colver St. and Wade Rd. from Manhole 72 to 75 ( Canborough St.) to Manhole 75 to 76 (Wade Rd.)

Project: Relocation of Shut-off Valve at Water Treatment Plant
Description: Install a new shut-off valve to replace an old and badly corroded valve located in the Sturgeon Falls Water Plant.

Project: Forcemain Upgrade at Holditch Street Extension
Description: Replace a section of sanitary force main pipe with water main quality pipe.

Project: Extension of Water Services on Railway Street
Description: Install 160 meters of watermain along Railway Street.
Result: Increased reliability in delivering drinking water in the area, provide alternate means for isolating main breaks and increase the chlorine residual without having to flush.

Description: Replace 100 meters of watermain along Main Street from Railway to Salter Street and to replace an old hydrant with a new hydrant with a storz steam port.

Project: Replacement and Extension of Ramsay Street Watermain
Description: Install 70 meters of watermain along Ramsay Street.
Result: Increased flow velocity and proper supply of water to the local hydrant.

Project: Structural Upgrade of Sand Hill Area Water Services
Description: Replace the pipe along Laronde Road and across Sand Hill Road to connect to the watermain on Tamarack, and on Cache Bay Road.
Result: Increased water flow and pressure, and reduced or eliminated dirty red water complaints.

Project: Upgrade of Brick Manholes in Sturgeon Falls
Description: Upgrade 14 manholes and replace 11 hydrants.
Complete the design and environmental assessment for the addition of a clarifier at the wastewater treatment plant to treat additional volumes and dealing with load capacities.
Result: Prepared for the expansion of a poultry processing plant that creates jobs for the municipality.

Description: Replace the watermain on Frances St.
Result: Improved service to 1,400 students and 50 households.

Project: Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition System at 37 Concession Street
Description: Complete the designs for a supervisory control and data acquisition system.

Project: Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition System Upgrade  37 Concession Street
Description: Upgrade the Water treatment plant supervisory control and data acquisition system and include  new programmable logic controller .
Construct a large sub-surface disposal system in  the Village of Westport.

Project: Stormwater Management Pond# PD33-03 Sediment Management
Description: Remove and dispose of 1,600 m3 of sediment from the stormwater pond, clean the outlets and restore the disturbed area.
Result: Improved efficiency and improved quality of the runoff released to the creeks.

Project: Study update of storm sewer outfalls for quality and erosion control enhancement.
Description: Complete a review of 44 storm sewer outfalls and 41 existing storm water ponds to identify any locations where any additional quality and erosion control enhancement can be provided.
Result: Improved quality of the water released from the outfalls to the creeks.

Project: Study update of existing stormwater management ponds for sediment removal.
Description: Conduct an inventory of 18 storm water management ponds to quantify existing sediment volumes and identify short term and long term sediment removal requirements.
Result: Based on this inventory, a  pond cleaning  program will be prepared and executed.

Project: Stormwater management pond # PD03-02 sediment management
Description: Remove and dispose of 2,600 m3 of sediment from the pond,  clean out the outlets and restore ation of the disturbed area.
Result: Improved quality of the water released from the outfalls to the creeks.

Project: Stormwater management pond # PD65-02 sediment management
Description: Remove and dispose of 530 m3 of sediment from the pond,  clean out the outlets and restore ation of the disturbed area.
Result: Improved quality of the water released from the outfalls to the creeks.

Project: Stormwater management pond # PD47-01 sediment management.
Description: Remove and dispose of 500 m3 of sediment from the pond,  clean out the outlets and restore ation of the disturbed area.
Result: Improved quality of the water released from the outfalls to the creeks.

Project: Stormwater management pond # PD48-01 sediment management.
Description: Remove and dispose of 1,500 m3 of sediment from the pond,  clean out the outlets and restore ation of the disturbed area.
Result: Improved quality of the water released from the outfalls to the creeks.

Project: Stormwater management pond # PD02-01 sediment management.
Description: Remove and dispose of 2,800 m3 of sediment from the pond,  clean out the outlets and restore ation of the disturbed area.
Result: Improved quality of the water released from the outfalls to the creeks.

Project: Replacement of Stouffer Street watermain and sanitary sewer
Description: Replace or repair the deteriorated watermain and sanitary sewer system.
Result: The infrastructure services approximately 52 households.

Project: Replacement of Waste Water Sewer Main Line
Description: Replace the forcemain from the main sewage pumping station to the treatment lagoon.
Result: Improved reliability of this aged and failing infrastructure.

Project: Upgrade Water Treatment Plant for Improved Water Treatability
Description: Upgrade or replace the raw and treated water analyzers, turbidity meters, programmable logic controller control panel and the supervisory control and data acquisition system.
Result: Improved water supply.

Description: Create an up to date asset management program.
Result: Safe and reliable drinking water.

Description: Replace the undersized, aging stationary emergency diesel generator set with a new suitably sized diesel generator.
Result: The Cobden water plant supplies potable water to roughly 980 users within the Village of Cobden.

Description: Design for a new rotating biological contactor, upgrade the existing lift station, a new vacuum assisted drying bed, a septage receiving facility and convert chlorination to ultraviolet disinfecting system.
Result: Prevented untreated wastewater from entering the environment and negatively impacting surrounding communities.

Description: Conduct a raw water sampling program extending over four seasons.
Result: Improved water quality at the water treatment plant.

Project: Storm Sewer on the Wilmot Employment Lands Site.
Description: Construct a storm water infrastructure to service the Wilmot Employment Lands site, located along the Highway 7/8 corridor.

Project: Sanitary Collection Mains on the Wilmot Employment Lands.
Description: Construction a sanitary sewer infrastructure to service the Wilmot Employment Lands site located along the Highway 7/8 corridor.
Install a new water meter reading system to allow for the remote reading of all water meters within the municipality.

Project: Construction of Watermain Underground at King Street
Description: Install a watermain underground as part of the road reconstruction works along King Street (Webster to George).
Result: Improved firefighting capabilities and improved water quality.

Description: Review the Pontiac pumping station drainage capacity, optimization and future needs

Project: St Paul Pumping Station Drainage Assessment
Description: Review the St Paul pumping station drainage capacity, optimization and future needs

Project: Campbell/ University area Stormwater management study - Storm Water Master Plan
Description: To prepare an environmental assessment and master plan for the Campbell/ University drainage area.

Project: Lou Romano Water Reclamation Plant Main Pumphouse Drywell Integrity and Reliability Improvements
Description: Conduct various repairs and upgrades to the Lou Romano water reclamation plant main pump house.
Result: Improved reliability of the main pump house pumping capacity.

Description: Install an odor control system to reduce corrosion of downstream collection system and reduce odor impacting neighboring properties.
Result: Reduced odor issues for neighboring properties.

Project: Upgrades to the Lou Romano Water Reclamation Plant (LRWRP) Biological Aerated Filter Backwash Supply Tank Screens
Description: Replace the current screening system to an automated self-cleaning one.
Result: Improved filter performance and effluent quality.

Project: Separation of existing combined sewers as well as watermain
Description: Remove approximately 400 m of combined sewer replacing with varying diameters of storm  sewers as well as sanitary lines.  The road will be resurfaced once the work is completed.
Result: Improved water service to 70 households.

Project: Storm sewer, wastewater, watermain and road rehabilitation
Description: Replace approximately 885 m of vitrified clay and concrete pipe with new polyvinyl chloride pipe and reinforced concrete pipe.  The road will be resurfaced once the work is completed.
Result: Improved water services to 47 households.

Project: Storm sewer, wastewater, watermain and road rehabilitation
Description: Replace and increase the capacity on 228 m. of existing storm sewer with concrete pipes ON Mount Carmel Dr., Cabana Rd W to Lennon Court.
Result: Improved water service to 30 to 40 households.

Project: South National Storm and Waste Water Relining
Description: Reline approximately 767 meters of sanitary and storm sewers.
Result: Improved water service to 519 households.

Project: Relining of Storm and Sanitary Pipes
Description: Reline 160 meters of storm and sanitary lines which run under a high school to ensure structural integrity.
Extend the combined sewers to address the overflow onto streets during significant rain events.
Result: Eliminate the overflow onto streets and property causing damage. This will benefit approximately 924 residents in the area.

Project: Conduct a sewer condition data acquisition study
Description: Inspect and assess 65% of the sewer network.
Result: Better asset management and identification of priorities for repairs.

Project: Improvements to a Youth Community Facility in Windsor
Description: This project involved replacing the roof over the east wing and gymnasium of the STAG community centre. The completion of this project means that STAG can create a more comfortable and safe environment to host a wide range of after-school programming, recreational events, homework clubs, peer group meetings, and crisis intervention services for youth and marginalized populations in Windsor-Essex County. It also means that more community members will be able to use the facility, building stronger community connections.
Create a new storm sewer and stormwater pond.
Result: Prevent flooding to private residences and businesses.

Project: Watermain Rehabilitation on Snyder Avenue North and William Street
Description: Replace, upgrade and complete separation of the combined sewer system on Snyder Avenue North and William Street.
Result: Improved water and wastewater servicing for 33 properties.

Project: Pilot Study for the Rehabilitation of the York-Durham Sewer
Description: Evaluate the application of geopolymer mortar lining system on 210 meters of 2.462 m diameter sanitary sewer as an innovative and cost effective methodology to mitigate the current infiltration into the sewer and structurally rehabilitate the sewer.
Apply a geopolymer mortar lining system on approximately 3 kilometers of sanitary sewer to mitigate the current infiltration into the sewer and structurally rehabilitate the sewer.

Project: Duffin Creek Wastewater Plant Field Testing for Phosphorus Removal
Description: Test to determine the Duffin Creek water pollution control plant to determine the plant’s capability to reliably achieve an effluent soluble reactive phosphorus (SRP) concentration of 0.1 mg/L and 0.05 mg/L.

Project: Emergency Bank Stabilization Works at German Mills Creek
Description: Construction of a 40-metre vegetated rock buttress  to protect and rehabilitate an exposed sanitary manhole.

Project: Natural Channel Rehabilitation of Patterson Creek
Description: Construction of 30 meters of new riffles, a minor channel realignment, 60 metres of vegetated rock revetment for bank stabilization, and 25 metres of woody habitat bank protection.

Project: German Mills Creek  Bank Stabilization and Sanitary Infrastructure Protection
Description: Conduct an environmental assessment for 4 sanitary protection sites in the John Street and Don Mills Road area.

Project: West Don River  Bank Stabilization and Sanitary Infrastructure Protection Project
Description: Protect 60 meters of linear infrastructure underneath the West Don River.

Project: Sanitary Infrastructure Protection and Stream Rehabilitation of East Don River
Description: Conduct an assessment and develop detailed designs to build protections for 25 metres of linear sanitary infrastructure near Avenue Road and Castle Rock Drive in the Town of Richmond Hill.

Project: Sanitary Infrastructure Protection and Stream Rehabilitation of East Don River
Description: Conduct an assessment and develop detailed designs to build protections for 35 metres of linear sanitary infrastructure near Weldrick Road West and Kersey Crescent in the Town of Richmond Hill.

Project: East Don River near May Avenue Bank Stabilization and Sanitary Infrastructure Protection Study
Description: Conduct an assessment and develop detailed designs to build protections for sanitary infrastructure near May Avenue and Kersey Crescent in the Town of Richmond Hill.

Project: Sanitary Infrastructure Protection and Stream Rehabilitation
Description: Conduct an assessment and develop detailed designs to build protections for 35 metres of linear sanitary infrastructure near  Royal Orchard Park north of Royal Orchard Boulevard at Bay Thorn Drive in the City of Markham.

Project: Sanitary Infrastructure Protection and Channel Stabilization
Description: Conduct an assessment and develop detailed designs to build protections for 65 metres of linear sanitary infrastructure near  Royal Orchard Park north of Royal Orchard Boulevard at Bay Thorn Drive in the City of Markham.
Address: Royal Orchard Park south of Royal Orchard Boulevard at Bay Thorn Drive in the City of Markham.

Project: East Don River Sanitary Infrastructure Protection and Channel Stabilization
Description: Conduct an assessment and develop detailed designs to build protections for 20 metres of linear sanitary infrastructure   beneath the East Don River near Bayview Avenue and Steeles Avenue East in the City of Markham.

Project: West Don River Sanitary Infrastructure Protection and Bank Protection
Description: Conduct an assessment and develop detailed designs to build protections for 45 metres of linear sanitary infrastructure underneath the West Don River between Highway 7 and Highway 407 ETR, south of Centre Street, in the City of Vaughan.

Project: Sanitary Infrastructure Protection and West Don River Bank Stabilization Project
Description: Conduct an assessment and develop detailed designs to build protections for 65 metres of linear sanitary infrastructure near Langstaff Road and Basaltic Road in the City of Vaughan.

Project: Sanitary Infrastructure Protection and Humber River Channel Stabilization
Description: Conduct an assessment and develop detailed designs to build protections for 30 metres of linear sanitary infrastructure underneath Humber River near Highway 407 ETR and Islington Ave in the City of Vaughan.

Project: Sanitary Infrastructure Protection and East Don River Channel Stabilization
Description: Conduct an assessment and develop detailed designs to build protections for 15 metres of linear sanitary infrastructure   underneath the East Don River I480near Bayview Avenue and Proctor Avenue in the Town of Richmond Hill.

Project: Sanitary Infrastructure Protection and German Mills Creek Channel Stabilization
Description: Conduct an assessment and develop detailed designs to build protections for 15 metres of linear sanitary infrastructure near Bayview Avenue and Proctor Avenue in the Town of Richmond Hill.

Project: Sanitary Infrastructure Protection and German Mills Creek Channel Stabilization
Description: Conduct an assessment and develop detailed designs to build protections for 70 metres of linear sanitary infrastructure underneath German Mills Creek near Palmer Avenue and Cedar Avenue in the Town of Richmond Hill.

Project: Replacement/rehabilitation of Markham Bullock Church Hwy 7 Ductile Iron Watermain
Description: Replace/install a structural liner in 2.5 km of diameter ductile iron watermain.
Result: Reduced water loss through leaks, fewer occurrences of watermain breaks and extended life of the watermain.

Project: Upper York Sewage Servicing Phosphorus Offset Program Pilot Study
Description: Conduct a pilot study to confirm the methods of phosphorus reduction from stormwater runoff at the Upper York sewage plant.

Project: Upper York Sewage Servicing Membrane Filtration System Pilot Study
Description: Conduct a 1-year pilot study to  demonstrate the ability of the system to meet performance criteria at the Keswick Water Resource Recovery Facility.
Install sub-meters to water and wastewater facilities to give users an ability to monitor and target their energy consumption.
Address: 7033 Leslie Street, 242 St. John's Sideroad, 10588 Keele Street, 153 Morton Ave, 4742 Steeles Ave West, 5270 16th Avenue, 8171 Bayview Avenue, 103 Pugsley Avenue, 10299 Highway No 27,  360 Bayview Parkway

Description: Study the technical feasibility of innovative technologies to supplement emergency back-up power for facilities currently utilizing diesel back-up generators.
Remove and replace a corrugated steel pipe culvert with a high-density polyethylene pipe culvert.
Inspect approximately 14 percent of the storm sewer network in various locations across York Region using closed-circuit television technology.
Result: Greater understanding of the condition of each location inspected.

Description: Purchase a new water truck for the community.
Result: More secure drinking water system.

Project: Accessibility Upgrades to Three Municipal Public Parks
Description: The project will upgrade accessibility at three parks and includes accessible pathways and a play structure designed for people with disabilities. The changes will improve access for all park users.

The project will install an accessibility lift and a hoist beam, which also involves drywall, framing, flooring, and painting. In addition, the furnace will be upgraded. The changes will improve accessibility to this historic building.

The project will construct a 3,500 square foot expansion to the community centre. The expansion will include a studio space, fitness area and accessible change rooms and showers. The expansion will better meet the recreational and social needs of residents and the surrounding communities.

The project will upgrade the mechanical, electrical, plumbing and lighting systems, doors, parking lot, as well as the acoustic panels and flooring in the gym. The changes will improve the quality, accessibility and safety of the facility.

Project: Bearskin Lake Community Beach and Pavillion
Description: The project will clean up two beach areas, add two pavilions and install picnic tables and potentially, washroom facilities. The upgrades will result in an improved recreational facility for residents and visitors to enjoy for years to come.

The project will rebuild the front steps of the library and add a ramp to improve accessibility, rebrick and parge exterior walls, and  rewire the entire building. The upgrades will improve community access and extend the life of this historic building.

The project will involve various accessibility upgrades, which include installing climb-assist railings in the upper balcony, replacing a portion of the current fixed seating with removable seating, upgrading and placing emergency alarms in the washrooms, and adding a wheelchair lift.Other work will include upgrading theatre lighting to LED technology, automating the current rigging system, and updating video infrastructure from analog to digital.
Result: Once complete, the project will enhance the accessibility of The Rose for both audiences and artists, and increase operational efficiency by reducing the time and labour required to present events and programming.

Project: Sunderland Memorial Arena & Community Centre Renovation and Expansion Project – CCRIS
Description: The project will expand the Centre to include six new dressing rooms, a community room, and storage for the ice resurfacer. Other improvements include expanding the ice surface, updating the refrigeration system, reconfiguring spectator seating and renovating the lobby, auditorium and existing dressing rooms. The upgrades will improve the Centre’s accessibility and allow residents to stay fit and healthy for years to come.

Project: Accessible Washroom & Equipment Storage for Soccer Recreational Facility
Description: The project will construct a building outfitted with washrooms, sports equipment storage and a future snack bar. The building will improve accessibility and the user experience for players and spectators.

Project: Renewal of the Civic Square for Burlington Residents
Description: The work involves the replacement of the existing pavement and stairs with a new, fully accessible and barrier-free surface. The existing fountain will be replaced with a new water feature, and trees will be planted to provide a healthy canopy. Further, new seating will be installed, and the outdoor mechanical and electrical systems upgraded.
Result: This investment will support the City of Burlington's efforts to make the Civic Square an accessible, safe and inclusive gathering and event space where festivals and community programming can be offered to all residents and visitors.

Project: Caledon Public Library Branch Renovation to Create a Maker, Media, and Innovation Lab
Description: The project will refurbish an existing library to a new service model that includes a maker space, meeting and training rooms, a recording studio, and spaces for co-working and connecting. The improvements will help ensure that residents have access to connectivity and technologies to support learning, innovation and entrepreneurship.

The project will repair the aquatic facility's foundation, install controls on the pool heating system to improve energy efficiency, replace benches and hangers in the pool and arena, expand showers in change rooms, and replace the main lobby flooring. The project will extend the life of the facility, increase energy efficiency and improve the user experience.

The project will rehabilitate four pedestrian bridges along the Caledon Trailway, and includes repairs to concrete abutment walls and replacement of timber frames, railings, and decking. The upgrades will improve the safety and accessibility of the trail.
The project will replace the aging recreational hall with a new multi-purpose accessible facility, update bathrooms, and remove safety hazards on the grounds.
Result: The improvements will allow Camp Tillicum to keep providing important recreational programs and services to children in the North Bay area.

Description: Renovations to the Chaplin Family YMCA will replace heating, ventilation and lighting systems as well as the exterior stucco to make the facility more energy and cost efficient.

Project: Rehabilitation of the historically designated Old Millbrook School – CCRIS
Description: Project work will include replacing the roof and windows with energy efficient alternatives; repairing damaged walls, floors, and doors; installing a new ventilation and air-exchanger system; and installing battery-operated accessible doors. These improvements will provide year-round access to indoor space for various social groups and services, while improving access to quality community, cultural and recreational infrastructure.

Project: Renovation of the Millbrook Arena to a multipurpose community hub – CCRIS
Description: Project work consists of the rehabilitation of existing steel girders, beams, walls and floors; converting the concession stand into accessible washrooms; and replacing the existing roof with an energy efficient alternative. An air ventilation system will also be installed to improve air quality. Once complete this facility will provide a space for year-round sports programming and community social activities.

Project: Revisioning the Bruce Johnston Branch as a Community Hub -- CCRIS
Description: This project will renovate the existing library to create a more accessible, functional, and energy efficient space. Work includes changing windows and doors, re-wiring the electrical system, relocating the public computer area and staff spaces, and renovating staff work zones to be more ergonomic, accessible, and functional. These renovations will provide a larger, more flexible space for clients and staff, improving the library experience and working environment.

Project: Renovation and Rehabilitation of the Elora Community Centre with an Arena
Description: The project will rehabilitate, renovate and expand the Elora Community Centre to improve its accessibility, increase its longevity and expand the utility of the space for new recreation, leisure and culture programming all of which will both increase the number and range of clientele. Work includes placement of the arena floor, board and glass and refrigeration equipment, accessibility upgrades, installation of emergency generator and solar panels.

Project: Rehabilitation and Renovation of a Community Centre
Description: Improvements to the Deseronto Community Centre include repairing the roof, HVAC system, and the north wall of the facility. Additionally, the project includes the creation of an outdoor sports pad for multi-use recreation, the addition of a barrier-free entrance, and renovations to the canteen and spectator seating to improve accessibility.

Project work will improve overall park infrastructure, which includes repairing the surface of tennis, basketball, and pickle ball courts; improving the accessibility of pathways, docks, courts, and picnic areas; and rehabilitating the exterior of the storage building. Further improvements include installing a play structure, a rain garden, a bike rack, and creating an off-leash dog park. A tree study will also take place to ensure adequate management of shade, soil water retention, and erosion control. A wi-fi network will also be established.
Result: These improvements will provide an accessible, modern, and safe recreation area for residents and visitors, while supporting various community, cultural and sporting events.

Project: Rehabilitate and expand Corbeil Park Recreation Hub
Description: The project work includes improvements to the park's soccer field; addition of an overhead cover with lighting for the outdoor rink; renovation of the existing tennis court and the construction of another; lighting and signage for the parking lot; and replacement of playground equipment with new accessible equipment. The project will enable the Municipality of East Ferris to improve access to recreational opportunities by providing a larger, safer, and more accessible facility.

Project: Replacement of Krall Park Washroom and Pavilion – CCRIS
Description: The project will replace the washrooms and pavilion, install backstop netting and cement pads in dug outs, and construct a new septic system and an accessible walkway from the parking lot to pavilion. The upgrades will improve access to and the quality of community and recreational infrastructure.

Project: Upgrades to Patrick Norris Community Park
Description: Patrick Norris Community Park upgrades will increase the quality of life for island residents and visitors by renovating the grounds into a multi-use community hub. The renovations will include installing an accessible washroom, constructing multi-use tennis courts, and improving playground equipment by installing a safety base underneath. Constructing a shelter/pavilion for picnic tables and music/cultural events, installing an electronic scoreboard for the baseball field, and upgrading the park fencing will help complete the project.

Project: Kemble Community Center Accessibility and Energy Efficiency Upgrades
Description: The project will upgrade the accessibility of entrances, washrooms and the parking area, and install a new steel roof, new flooring, and a heat pump HVAC system. The insulation, electrical and fire suppression systems will also be upgraded. The changes will improve access to recreational and social services, and increase energy efficiency.

Project: Completing the Renovations to the Barn Area at Clearwater Farm – CCRIS
Description: The project will rehabilitate a barn, construct a new play space, install additional utilities and lighting, improve accessibility (elevator, washrooms, pathways), and expand the parking lot. These improvements will create a recreational and cultural community hub which residents and visitors can access year-round.

Project: Updating the Grand Valley and District Community Centre
Description: The project will install a new floor in the arena which will include new dasher boards, concrete work, refrigeration lines, and add six change rooms. The changes will improve the quality and functionality of the facility, and help meet the community's growing recreational needs.

Project: Expanding and renovating accessible community space at the YMCA-YWCA of Guelph.
Description: The project involves a three storey addition to the YMCA of Guelph to provide youth recreational space and an expansion of the universal change room to enhance access to the facility for those with physical disabilities and families with young children. The expansion will add a footprint of 2,000 square feet to the facility resulting in 6,000 square feet of new space.

Project: Rehabilitation of a century church building and 3-storey rear addition Community Centre
Description: The rehabilitation of the 100-year-old church building and the construction of a three-storey community centre will allow HOPE House to expand its community services and operations. The work includes upgrades to the building's masonry and rehabilitating the flat roof.

Project: Upgrading of the Haliburton County Rail Trail Corridor – CCRIS
Description: The project work includes improving 30 kilometers of trail with granular overlay; installing 15 benches, 500 meters of barrier, and informational signage to highlight trail history, the natural environment, and trail accessibility. This project will provide an improved recreational experience for users, while reducing annual maintenance costs.

The project will renovate the gymnasium to include updated surfacing with multi-sport court lines, new adjustable basketball nets, and improvements to safety features including foam padding to areas under the net and stage area to reduce the risk of injury during activities. These upgrades will improve the quality of physical literacy programming, the safety of the gymnasium floor, and reduce barriers for persons with disabilities.

Project: Central Memorial Recreation Centre Elevator Modernization and Replacement
Description: The project will replace the elevator at the Central Memorial Recreation Centre in Hamilton. Various components of the elevator will be replaced including wiring and control systems, the car and cabin interior, fixtures, door equipment, hall button panels, and the valve, pump and tank.

Project: Hamilton Amateur Athletic Association Park Redevelopment
Description: The project will create barrier-free accessible pathways throughout the park, improve drainage for better grass growth, and upgrade the lighting to LED. The playground and spray pad amenities will also be upgraded to replace assets that have reached end-of-life.

Project: Recreation Facility Roof Replacements and Retrofits
Description: The project will repair and replace roofs at the Mohawk Ice Centre, Benneto Community Centre, Dundas Community Pool, and Chedoke Golf Club. These improvements will extend the life of these recreational facilities for years to come.

Project: Improvement and Repairs to the Royal Botanical Gardens in Burlington
Description: Project work will include reconstructing a boathouse, a viewing platform and boardwalk; repairing nature trails and garden paths; and installing an entry gate for the Hendrie Valley Trails. Improvements also include enlarging the Rock Trail parking lot and making it more accessible, and updating wayfinding signage and audio units to adhere to the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. These improvements and upgrades will create a more safe and accessible space, while also providing a more enjoyable visitor experience.

Project: Trail Bridges Replacement  Hanover Community Trails System
Description: The project will replace three trail bridges and rehabilitate another in the Hanover Community Trails System. The trail rehabilitation will improve the quality and accessibility of recreational infrastructure, and will promote active transportation.

Project: Havelock - Belmont - Methuen Community Centre Improvements
Description: The project involves multiple upgrades, including the installation of an elevator and other access improvements. In addition, the roof system will be replaced, the refrigeration system improved, the basement area will be repurposed to create new space for recreational events and programming, and the fire alarm and suppression systems will be replaced. The project will support the continued delivery of recreational services and programming to the community.

Project: Kincardine to Inverhuron Provincial Park (KIPP) Trail
Description: The project will construct a 12 kilometre, paved trail between Kincardine and Inverhuron Provincial Park. The new trail will support healthy living and provide a safe and scenic connection to communities and facilities in the municipality.

Project: New $53 million Recreational Complex for the Township of King
Description: The project will see the construction of a new recreation centre for the Township of King and will include twin ice pad surfaces, an indoor year-round pool and track, gym equipment and multipurpose fitness studio space for yoga, aerobics, and spin classes. The recreation centre will also house a multiuse field house with operable doors to surrounding amenities, including baseball and soccer fields. The project will also explore a number of energy efficient measures for the facility such as natural ventilation, reclaiming waste heat from the refrigeration system, and an open-loop geothermal heat exchange.
Result: This new complex will provide residents in the Township of King and surrounding communities access to modern and reliable recreational infrastructure where they can enjoy sports, maintain healthy lifestyles and take part in recreational programs and services for years to come.

Project: Renovation and Addition of an Ice Plant and Multi-Purpose Room for Kingfisher Lake First Nation (KLFN)
Description: The project will renovate and install a new ice plant at the arena and rehabilitate the mezzanine to allow for sports and training. The upgrades will promote community health and wellness, and will improve community access to recreational activities for years to come.

The project will create a multi-use trail to connect the Iron Horse Trail with the future King Victoria Transit Hub planned for construction in 2021. It will be a focal point for higher order transit service in Waterloo Region, connecting passengers seamlessly through the co-location of our Regional LRT - the ION, GO Transit's rail and bus service, VIA rail service, intercity bus, and passenger vehicles and promote active living.
The project will replace the roof and rehabilitate washrooms to improve accessibility. Once completed, residents and visitors will enjoy a modern and accessible cultural venue.

Project: Renovation and Rehabilitation of AR Kaufman YMCA
Description: The project will replace the pool air handling unit (AHU) with a heat recovery ventilator, replace the roof and rooftop AHU, and upgrade facility lighting to LED. The updates will improve energy efficiency, decrease operating costs, reduce the risk of structural or system failure, and increase client comfort.

Project: Construction of RBJ Schlegel Aquatic Centre in Kitchener
Description: Project work for the aquatic centre will include the construction of an eight-lane, 25-metre long pool with a removable floor and ramp access, bleacher seating, community use multi-purpose rooms, public washrooms, and food and beverage services. Once complete, the new aquatic centre will provide greater access to recreational facilities and services for members of the Kitchener community to lead healthy, active lifestyles.

The project includes the removal of the existing Timber Trestle bridge and replacement with a new Bailey style structure supported by new abutments and approaches on either side. Once completed, access will be restored for the more than 5,500 users of this recreational trail which connects multiple communities.

Project: Upgrades to Legion Park Softball Diamond
Description: Upgrades to the Legion Park Softball diamond include replacing the existing halogen stadium lights with brighter, energy efficient LED lights. A new electrical panel with a timed lighting system will improve public safety and encourage more use of the facility in the evenings. Backstop fencing behind and above home plate will be removed and replaced, ensuring continued public safety during sporting events.

Project: Improvements to the café and meeting room facilities at the Community Living North Halton building
Description: The upgrades include replacement of existing carpet with vinyl flooring, adding new light fixtures, updating washrooms, expanding the café meeting area, and repainting meeting spaces. These upgrades will improve the access and quality of the community infrastructure by enabling the organization to offer more space for programming and meetings in this facility.

Project: Rehabilitation and expansion of the Crawford Lake Boardwalk
Description: These upgrades to the recreational path will include the installation of helical piles for boardwalk support and new decking and guardrails, and the refurbishment of rest stops, viewing areas and educational signage. These improvements will extend the boardwalk's lifespan and offer an improved visitor experience, while also meeting accessibility requirements.

Project scope includes constructing an additional respite dorm; and improving the safety and accessibility of indoor and outdoor spaces like trails, waterfront areas, and classrooms. Other improvements will extend the service life of the dining hall and laundry facilities and provide winterization and accessibility to sleeping cabins. The project will increase the seasonal capacity of the facility and provide greater access to preventative respite for children with an Autism Spectrum Disorder.

Project: Renovation and Expansion of a Recreation Facility and its Grounds
Description: The project will renovate existing and add new dressing rooms, upgrade lighting at a baseball field, and construct a third baseball diamond with backstop fencing. The upgrades will improve the access, safety and quality of recreational infrastructure.

Project: Construction of Two Additional Tennis Courts and Related Infrastructure at Mono Tennis Club in Mono Centre
Description: The project will construct two accessible tennis courts with fencing and lighting as well as accessible washrooms and a new parking area. The upgrades will improve accessibility and the user experience, and support the expansion of tennis programs.

Project: Construction of a Multi-Use Accessible Pedestrian Trail along Boyne River in Community of Alliston
Description: The project will construct a 350 metre multi-use and accessible pedestrian trail, which will include a new asphalt path, rest areas, benches, signage, lighting and landscaping. The path will improve  accessibility and facilitate active transportation by connecting downtown to amenities at Riverdale Park.

Project: Improvements to Riverdale Park in Alliston
Description: The project will  design and construct a new pavilion, and install shade features at the splash pad area, two playground structures and a rubberized surface at Rotary Park. The upgrades will offer improved and increased opportunities for inclusive play.

Project: District 11, Near North Trail Association Snowmobile Trail Improvements
Description: The project will replace two bridges and upgrade three more, install new railings, 14 culverts, and includes the purchase of new equipment to maintain remote sections of trails.
Result: This work will improve the safety and the user experience for snowmobilers along District 11's 1,900 kilometre trail system, and further support the Ontario Federation of Snowmobile Clubs.

Project: Development of Hallville Community Park – CCRIS
Description: The project will develop vacant municipal land into a multi-purpose park. Work will include drainage and elevation of low-lying areas, electrification, and drilling of a well. In addition, accessible swings and picnic tables, lighted bike and pedestrian paths will be installed along with a parking lot, baseball diamond, soccer field and an outdoor rink with washrooms. The adjacent roadway will also be widened with delineators placed to encourage active transportation, and trees planted throughout the park. The new park will provide residents with an accessible and modern community and recreational space to enjoy for years to come.

Project: Refurbishment of the Glengarry Sports Palace – CCRIS
Description: The refurbishment of the Glengarry Sports Palace includes the replacement of a concrete arena slab, rink boards and glass, windows and doors, lighting and a boiler while the spectator seating area and ventilation, plumbing, and electrical systems will also be improved. Other updates involve fire safety upgrades and the addition of a gender inclusive bathroom and players’ rooms. The refurbishment will create a safer and more accessible place for players and spectators and provide residents with a modern sports centre where residents can stay fit and healthy for years to come.

Project: Rehabilitation of the North Huron Wescast Community Complex (NHWCC)
Description: The project will replace the pool dehumidifier, lower roof, and insulation in interior walls, and remove barriers to showers in the changerooms and dressing rooms. In addition, the sound system will be replaced while baffling in the hall, basketball hoops, and an indoor walking surface will be installed. The upgrades will improve accessibility and use of the facility while increasing energy efficiency and managing humidity levels.

Project: Improvement to Lion's Head Community Centre and Arena
Description: The project will expand and rehabilitate the community centre and arena by adding six, barrier-free dressing rooms, a multi-purpose room, new library space, and by rehabilitating and adding new  washrooms to address accessibility. The changes will improve community access and functionality, and encourage healthy lifestyles.

Project: Eastern Ontario Trails Alliance - Trail Network Revitalization
Description: The rehabilitation and repair of 21 bridge structures along the Hastings Heritage Trail and reconditioning of various sections of the 550-kilometre trail network. Reconditioning of the trails will include resurfacing, and grading modifications. Structure repairs will include the rehabilitation of various bridge decks and pedestrian barriers.

The project will install a sound masking system at the Orillia Public Library. The changes will reduce noise levels in the library's quiet zone to allow for research and study, and increase the accessibility of the space to more users.

Project: Optimiste Park - Genest Outdoor Pool Replacement
Description: Modernizing the 57-year-old pool facility will include expanding the pool basin, installing a new pool deck and fencing, and improving underground infrastructure and operating systems. Funding will also support the addition of lifeguard stations, a chemical storage area, increased shaded areas, and accessible change-rooms, pool, and pathways.This project will support increased recreational programming in the community, a safe and modern facility.

Project: Renovations at the Vanier Francophone Center
Description: The scope of work includes creating a new, multi-purpose space to replace the existing bowling room. Bowling lanes, seats and machinery will be removed, and windows and two additional exists will be installed. These renovations will allow the centre to provide more diverse and accessible services and community programming to area residents.

This project will replace the facility's roof, upgrade the HVAC system, and improve thermal efficiency. These enhancements will provide a more comfortable environment for clients and staff, while improving energy efficiency, and reducing operating costs.

Project: Construction of an outdoor wood pavilion
Description: The project involves the construction of an outdoor wood pavilion, adjacent to the Trend-Arlington Community Centre. The project will use wood milled from the community's fallen trees, collected after the September 21, 2018 tornado.This project will enhance community living through increased access to new recreation and outdoor event spaces, strengthening community connections, and providing more opportunities for residents to get outside and be active. This project will also memorialize the day of the tornado, and the community's resilience and strength in rebuilding what was lost.

Project: Renovation and Expansion of the Kanata Recreation Centre in Ottawa
Description: The project will renovate and expand the Kanata Recreation Centre and splash pad by adding new meeting and program rooms, updating the interior, installing an emergency exit stairwell to increase program capacity, upgrading the facility's lobby by adding a customer service centre and vestibule, and improving and enlarging the nearby splash pad at Walter Baker Park. Once completed, the updated Kanata Recreation Centre will provide better access to quality cultural, community and recreational spaces, and offer residents and families a safer, more enjoyable place to gather.

The project will rehabilitate and expand venues at Centennial Park. The work includes constructing a new skateboard park, replacing the boards on the outdoor rink, building two basketball courts, improving landscaping and signage, and increasing accessibility by upgrading the park furniture.

The project will replace non-accessible and end-of-life playground equipment at 29 locations across Ottawa. The project includes the addition of new accessible benches, swings, play structures and adjacent pathways.

Project: Renovation of the Kitchen in the Community Centre at 36 Main Street in Penetanguishene
Description: The project will install accessible counters, cabinets, and work surfaces, which will include plumbing, electrical and painting work. The renovation will improve the accessibility and quality of the community kitchen.

Project: Enhancing Accessibility and Safety at the Mount Community Centre
Description: The project will upgrade the community centre by installing an elevator and upgrading washrooms to improve accessibility. Other work will include replacing sanitary lines, upgrading storm water management and creating additional parking spaces. The project will allow more community residents to access recreational activities.

Project: Addressing Accessibility Deficiencies at the Trout Creek Community Centre
Description: he project will construct an accessible ramp, install hands-free hardware and railings, purchase four sets of publicly accessible bleachers for community events, and install new accessible playground equipment.
Result: The upgrades will improve the Centre's accessibility and allow more residents to enjoy recreational activities for years to come.

Project: New Recreational Complex for the Town of Prescott
Description: The project will see the construction of an all-year, multiuse recreational complex in Prescott. The new recreational complex will include an indoor single ice pad surface with seating capacity of 800 on both sides, a walking track, multiple community rooms with multiuse functions, outdoor softball diamonds and outdoor soccer fields. This new complex will provide residents in Prescott, and surrounding communities, access to a modern and reliable recreational facility where they can enjoy sports, maintain healthy lifestyles, and partake in recreational programs for years to come.

Project: Replacement of the Lights and Upgrading of the Washrooms at the Old Morriston Park
Description: The project will install new baseball  lights and re-service and upgrade park washrooms. The improvements will meet community needs for updated and accessible recreational facilities.

Project: Puslinch Community Centre Renovation and Upgrade
Description: The project will upgrade the soccer field, parking lot, site drainage, landscaping, and provide lighted walkway connections. Other renovations will involve an accessible play area, a gazebo, a picnic shelter and new bleachers, lighting, fencing and an upgraded track at the tractor pull venue. The project will improve the quality of community space, address evolving needs and result in a more accessible, multi-use recreational hub.

Project: Construction of an Outdoor Recreation Court at Crossings
Description: The project will design, supply and install a concrete pad and outdoor, multi-use court for basketball and pickleball along with fencing. The new venue will provide greater access to outdoor recreational activities for all community members.

Project: Reconstruction of Lovely Day Park Playground
Description: The project will design and construct a new playground structure, and remove existing equipment. The new structure  will improve safety and accessibility, and enable recreation activities to be enjoyed year-round.

Project: Rehabilitation of 1875 Log School House and 1850 Log Home, Exterior Exhibits at Bruce County Museum and Cultural Centre
Description: The project will  re-shingle the roofs of two historic buildings  and replace windows, window casings, and an exterior log. The upgrades will improve the safety and functionality of the buildings, and decrease operation and maintenance costs.

Project: New Twin-Pad Arena for Sault Ste. Marie
Description: The twin-pad arena will replace the existing single-pad arena at the McMeeken Arena, significantly increasing the square-footage and seating capacity inside the arena for the Sault Ste. Marie community.

Project: Accessibility and Renovation Improvements to the Historical Town Hall 1873 Building – CCRIS
Description: The project will renovate the ground floor ancillary space by installing a new freight and passenger elevator, upgrading the kitchen, improving the sound system, redesigning and addressing safety issues in the green room washroom and change facilities, and refurbishing the historic bell tower. These renovations will create more artistic and cultural opportunities, and improve the building’s accessibility, allowing more residents to enjoy the theatre.

The project will install a multi-sport, outdoor court by providing a hydro connection to the site, applying athletic surfacing and lines, and installing adjustable basketball net posts and  lighting. The outdoor court will provide new sports activities for the community and encourage healthy living.

The project will install suitable boards with proper gates and latches for an outdoor rink/ playing surface, along with new netting and lighting. The changes will improve the safety, use and accessibility of the facility.

Project: Centre Dufferin Recreation Complex Pitched Roof Replacement
Description: The project will install a new roofing system that includes roofing and flashing membranes, a vapor retarder, top overlay board, bottom insulation  and waterproofing. The improvements will better protect the facility from leaks that could damage assets and cause service disruptions.

Project: Mildmay Carrick Recreation Complex (MCRC) Rehabilitation Project
Description: The project will replace aging refrigeration equipment in the arena with a new compressor, evaporation condenser, insulation lines, and a dehumidifier. In addition, the ceiling above the rink will be painted and kitchen cabinets and countertops replaced in the recreation hall. The project will improve energy efficiency, reduce maintenance costs and support the expansion of recreational and social programming.

Project: Teeswater-Culross Community Centre Rehabilitation and Renovation
Description: The project will  renovate and rehabilitate the facility by replacing the refrigeration plant, incorporating a barrier-free design and implementing energy efficiencies. The upgrades will improve accessibility, reduce operation and maintenance costs, and extend the life of the asset.

Project: Accessibility Improvements for the Frontenac K&P Trail
Description: The Frontenac K&P Trail will be improved by upgrading accessibility to the Verona Trailhead major access point and other minor access points, and by removing barriers at other minor access points. Work also includes improving road cross safety features, constructing rest areas, installing park benches, shelters, and trail counters, and other upgrades to meet the Accessibility of Ontarians with Disabilities Act requirements.

The Frontenac Community Arena will be upgraded by improving the ice quality and increasing accessibility features for spectators and patrons. In addition, improvements will increase safety measures for staff and patrons and reduce annual operating and maintenance costs. Other work includes the replacement of various arena equipment such as the timekeeper box, benches, boards, and glass.

Project: Char-Lan Recreation Centre Ice Pad Replacement – CCRIS
Description: The project will replace the refrigerated concrete ice pad along with the dasher boards, glass and netting. The project will improve the safety and accessibility of the arena and provide residents with continued access to recreational activities for years to come.
The project will construct four 20 by 40 feet pavilions in four community parks. The accessible pavilions will provide visitors with shade and protection from inclement weather.

The project will install an accessible play structure and surface and remove existing structures and pea stone surfaces. The improvements will allow more residents to access recreational infrastructure.

Project: Improved recreation facilities for a community centre in St.-Charles
Description: Upgrades to the Community Arena will increase occupancy rates and allow the facility to safely host major community events. Once improvements are complete, the renovated facility will feature an updated fire alarm system and widened doors, a new ice resurfacer, new fitness equipment, and a new splash pad.
Result: These renovations will improve safety and accessibility of the facility and enable St.-Charles residents and visitors alike to enjoy the facility for years to come.

Project: Stone Mills Recreation Centre Arena Floor Replacement
Description: Upgrades to the Stone Mills Recreation Centre include replacing the existing arena floor with a new concrete slab and in-floor refrigeration piping. The project also includes the construction of new rink boards and alterations to the Ice Resurfacer entrance.

Project: Capital Improvements to the Marsh Street Centre
Description: The project will replace and repair exterior bricks, install new signage, replace the stage ceiling and improve lighting. The practice rooms will also be upgraded with new soundproofing, drywall, carpet and a ventilation system while an accessible washroom will be renovated. The changes will improve the safety, accessibility and functionality of the facility.

Project: Renovations at the Beaver Valley Community Centre
Description: The project will replace the parking lot and roof, update lighting, windows, and doors to increase energy efficiency, and upgrade the HVAC system. The changes will improve the functioning and energy efficiency of the community centre.

The project will replace the skating rink at Toanche Park with a covered skating pavilion with open sides and natural ice, and construct a support building with restrooms, changerooms, storage and a community meeting room. The upgrades will provide local and area residents with better access to the facility.
The project involves a 15,479 square foot expansion of the existing facility, which will include six multi-purpose rooms, a music room, common room, and a robotics lab.
Result: Once complete, the Armenian Community Centre of Toronto will become a more comprehensive, multi-purpose community hub that will offer additional programming to meet growing cultural and recreational needs and is expected to result in an additional 15,000 residents served per year.

Description: The project will rehabilitate the Norseman Community Pool. The work will include replacing the roof, upgrading the HVAC system, improving the pool tank and deck, and renovating the change rooms to improve accessibility.

Project: Capital Asset Management Program: Artificial Ice Rink State of Good Repair for Sir Adam Beck and Rosedale Facilities
Description: The project will rehabilitate both the Sir Adam Beck and Rosedale artificial outdoor ice rinks. The work will include replacing the refrigeration plants, upgrading mechanical rooms, replacing concrete pads, headers and piping, installing dasher boards and improving accessibility.

The project will rehabilitate the existing High Park Forest School by undertaking structural upgrades and pest control, and installing new HVAC, mechanical, electrical, sprinkler, emergency power, lighting and safety systems. Accessibility will also be improved with the addition of two lifts.
Result: The project will improve access to community and recreational infrastructure by providing additional space for Nature Centre programming.

Description: The project will eliminate curbs and damaged trail surfaces, improve drainage, and add seating and landscaping.
Result: The upgrades will improve the quality, access and recreational experience of the trail, and ameliorate flooding.

Description: The project will upgrade the mechanical rooms and replace the refrigeration plant, dehumidifier, piping, concrete pad, dasher boards and protective glass for one ice surface.
Result: The rehabilitation will improve accessibility, functionality of the arena, and the quality of experience for users while promoting healthy lifestyles.

Project: Rehabilitation of Pine Point and Bill Bolton Arenas
Description: The project will upgrade and replace the concrete ice pad surfaces, piping,  dasher boards and refrigeration plant, and upgrade the electrical system and mechanical room at each arena.
Result: The rehabilitation will support the continuation of recreational services and promote healthy lifestyles.

Project: Rehabilitation of Ramsden Park Outdoor Twin Pad Artificial Ice Rink
Description: The project will replace the refrigeration system and ice pads, upgrade the electrical system, building envelope, mechanical room and lighting, replace the dasher boards and protective screening, and improve accessibility.
Result: The rehabilitation will provide better access to the park,  support the continuation of recreational programming, and promote healthy lifestyles.

Description: The project includes state of good repair works to building components such as the rink pad surface, refrigeration plant, roof, exterior stair, retaining wall, and windows, in addition to accessibility improvements. This work will extend the lifespan and improve the quality of the Downsview arena, and will also allow residents to have better access to skating programs, youth ice sports, and public skating for years to come.

Project: Upgrades and Repairs to George Bell Arena in Toronto
Description: Project work will include extensive roof replacements, mechanical and electrical upgrades, and arena equipment refurbishment. Further, accessibility improvements will be made to the front entrance, washrooms, and pathways from the parking area to the ice skating pad. These upgrades will extend the life of the arena, reduce operating costs, and provide recreation opportunities for community members of all ages and abilities.

Project: Construction of the Campbellford Recreation and Wellness Centre – CCRIS
Description: Funding will support the construction of a new multipurpose recreation facility. Work includes building an NHL-sized rink, a lane pool, therapy pool, a fitness room, and multipurpose room. This will provide residents, and surrounding communities, with improved access to modern recreational facilities.

Project: Replacement of Existing Culvert on Trail E108 with New Engineered Steel Bridge
Description: The project will replace a deteriorated, 4' diameter culvert with a new 30' clear span steel bridge that includes bearing pads and buttress improvements. Work will improve water flow, and stabilize the existing trail bed and riverbanks from erosion.

Project: Tweed Kiwanis Memorial Park Accessible Playground Rehabilitation
Description: Upgrades to the Kiwanis Memorial Park playground project will make it more accessible and barrier-free for all users. New features of the park include a rubber surface which will enable wheelchair access, as well as accessible equipment such as zip lines, swings, gliders and spinners.

The project will construct a new, 6,000 square foot building with multi-purpose spaces and an indoor running and walking track, and demolish a 50-year old structure. The project will provide space for recreation, cultural activities, and community services to better serve vulnerable youth and families.

Project: Second Story Addition Stork Family YMCA
Description: The project will add a second storey consisting of 4500 square feet of multi-purpose space. The new space will support the expansion of health management programming for individuals dealing with chronic health issues, and allow for additional youth and adult programming.

Project: YMCA Outdoor Centre - Improve Septic System
Description: The project will replace an aging and non-compliant septic system, and reconnect the plumbing to the new system. The new system will meet  regulatory requirements and provide a safe, reliable service for children and youth using the venue for school programs and summer camps.

Project: Community Skating Trail for Whitchurch-Stouffville Residents
Description: The work involves constructing a multi-season trail in the Town's primary community park that will be used for skating during winter months. In addition, the project will involve construction of accessible washrooms and changerooms, a shed for the ice resurfacer and a bridge for the resurfacer to access the trail. This investment will support the creation of a fully accessible, inclusive, community hub where residents can enjoy the outdoors, and stay fit and healthy for years to come.
Woodstock YMCA Recreation Facility Rehabilitation

The project will replace existing trusses with steel girders, repair and replace the roof, and re-install the fire alarm system. The improvements will help protect and preserve the heritage bridge while providing continued access to pedestrians, cyclists, horse and buggies, and small vehicles.
Replace pipes located under Principal Street.
Result: Increased safety and eliminate the weight limits on vehicle using Principal Street.

Description: Replace Soper's Bridge with a new two-lane concrete girder bridge.
Install pumps,  pipes, valves, magnetic flowmeters,  miscellaneous mechanical and system upgrades, and upgrade of building envelope.
Result: Improved operational capability and reliability of the station.

Description: Replace Bridge 0013 on Chepstow Road, east of Side Road 5 in Brockton.

Project: Inspection, Design and Rehabilitation of Rail Crossing Culverts
Description: Assess  and make recommendations for the design and rehabilitation of 14 storm sewers crossing under the C.N. tracks in the rail corridors.
Result: Longer service life of the storm sewers, and protection and safety of railway operations.

Project: Replacement of Plains Road West Culverts
Description: Remove and upgrade 7 corrugated steel pipe culverts.

Project: Moyer's Bridge and McLean Road Upgrades
Description: Upgrade Moyer's Bridge and reconstruct McLean Road from County Road 34 to the McLean Road and Concession 7 intersection.

Project: Chippewas of Nawash First Nation Community Road Repairs
Description: Repair roads and replace culverts in the Chippewas of Nawash First Nation Community.

Project: New Construction on Locke Avenue Water Supply Pipeline.
Description: install 80 meters of piping on Scott Ave. from Campground to Locke Avenue.ts
Result: More reliable access to safe drinking water, and improved ability to meet projected growth.

Description: Replace the 8th Line Bridge with a new 2 lane bridge.
Replace the culvert at Mikkola Road.

Replace the culvert at Manninen Road.
Replace the culvert at Edward Avenue.
Replace the culvert at Seguin Street.
Replace the culvert at Nickel Basin Road.
Replace the culvert at MR55.
Replace the culvert at Tilton Lake Road.

Project: Glen Lawson Road and Third Line Improvements
Description: Upgrade approximately 1.5 kilometres of Glen Lawson Road, from Fourth Line to Churchill Road South/Third Line, and Churchill Road South/Third Line, from Glen Lawson Road to Rachlin Drive in Halton Hills.
Construct a roundabout at the intersection of Grey County Roads 3 and 4 in West Grey.
Remove the Blackwater Bridge and replace it with a culvert.
Result: Increased lifespan and capacity of the water crossing and improved environmental outcomes.

Project: Drummond Road, Gallinger Street and Portage Road Reconstruction
Description: Reconstruct approximately 2.5 kilometres of Drummond Road (Thorold Stone Road to Morrison Street),Gallinger Street and Portage Road (Elizabeth Street to Althea Street) in Niagara Falls.
Replace Big Creek Bridge in Norfolk County.

Project: Road-sewer-water renewal for Florence St  and McLeod Ave.
Description: Complete the preliminary design for the rehabilitation of the combined sewer on Florence Street, and the watermain and sewer on McLeod Street.
Replace the one-lane McEwing Bridge over Mill Creek with a new, two-lane structure.
Rehabilitate approximately 7.7 kilometres of road, reconstruct approximately 1.4 kilometres of road, and repair two bridge decks in Bruce County.
Conduct an environmental assessment to determine the preferred solution to address stormwater drainage in the community of Thornbury to the west of the Beaver River.

Result: Compliance with the Ministry of Environment's Environmental Compliance Approval (ECA) for stormwater management facilities,  and extended life of the asset.

Result: Improved public health and safety concerns, traffic flow for motorist and pedestrians, emergency response, and reduce the probability of asset failure and service interruptions.

Rehabilitate approximately 1.5 kilometers of St. Ann’s Road between Twenty Mile Road and Regional Road Twenty, and upgrade the St. Ann’s Bridge .
Replace the bridge over Nith River  in the Township of Wilmot with a new, two-lane concrete structure.
Result: Improved load, width, and height restrictions at this bridge.

Description: Waterloo ION station linked to Uptown Waterloo neighbourhood. It serves those heading north from Allen.
