Description: Construction of light rail transit between Conestoga Mall (Waterloo) and Fairview Park Mall (Kitchener ), and bus rapid transit between Fairview Park Mall and the Ainslie Street Terminal (Cambridge).
Waterloo ION station, located in the centre of the road, at the intersection of King and Allen.
Result: It will serve the neighbourhoods of Mary Allen and Uptown West, and provide easy access to the Iron Horse Trail for walking and  cycling.

Description: Waterloo ION station, located in the centre of the road right in front of Grand River Hospital.
Result: It will provide easy access for patients, visitors, and staff of the hospital and surrounding medical services.

Description: Waterloo ION station, located within the City of Kitchener's Innovation District, in the heart of a transformed downtown neighbourhood.
Result: It will provide important connections to GO Transit and VIA Rail services.

Description: Waterloo ION station, serving southbound trips.
Result: It will serve a growing number of downtown residents, with residential development continuing in this area.

Description: Waterloo ION station, serving northbound trips. Nearby destinations include St Mary's Church and the Kitchener Downtown Community Centre.
Result: It will provide access to numerous events and activities in Downtown Kitchener as well as nearby Victoria Park.

Description: The second of two ION stops serving downtown Kitchener, providing access to the Waterloo Region Courthouse.
Result: Those attending major events in the region will use this stop to attend shows at the Centre in the Square and Oktoberfest activities. It will also provide access to major employers such as the Region of Waterloo and Manulife.

Description: Waterloo ION station serving southbound trips.
Result: Those attending major events in the region will use this stop to attend shows at the Centre in the Square and Oktoberfest activities. It will provide access to major employers such as the Region of Waterloo and Manulife.

Description: Waterloo ION station, serving several adjoining residential areas including the established Cameron Heights neighbourhood.
Result: This area has a high potential for redevelopment.

Description: Waterloo ION station, which links to GRT and future iXpress service along Ottawa.
Result: It will provide access to local fitness centres including Grand River Rocks and Cross Fit Kitchener.

Description: Waterloo ION station, located within a residential neighbourhood, beside the Central Baptist Church.
Result: It will consist of one centre platform on the rail line east of Ottawa. It will develop into a major transfer point for GRT and iXpress buses.

Description: Construction of light rail transit between Conestoga Mall (Waterloo) and Fairview Park Mall (Kitchener ), and bus rapid transit between Fairview Park Mall and the Ainslie Street Terminal (Cambridge).

A key connection point on the ION route, linking LRT in Kitchener with adapted bus rapid transit, which extends south to the Ainslie Street transit terminal in Cambridge. It is an important gateway to GRT, providing access to numerous local bus routes as well as iXpress services.
Result: ION passengers will use this stop to access one of the region's largest shopping centres, ensuring a convenient connection for shoppers and employees.

Description: Construct 1.72 km of new bike lanes on Ottawa Street from King Street to Highway 7.
Result: Continuous cycling route along Ottawa Street from adjacent bike lanes, connecting to the new Borden Avenue ION rapid transit station.

Description: Construct a pedestrian and cycling bridge at Highway 7/8.
Result: Improved active transportation options for residents and increased access to the public transit system

Description: Construction of a 1.9 km multi-use trail on  Lackner Boulevard.
Result: Expanded active transportation network and improved connectivity to the public transit system.

Description: Expand the Conestoga College Doon Campus transit station to include six new buses and a bus terminal, bike parking, heated shelters and new signage.
Result: Safer and more efficient public transit system.

Project: Market Trail to ION Light Rail Transit
Description: Construct a 1.7 km shared-use active transportation trail to ION Light Rail Transit, including 10 bike racks, improvements at 3 road crossings, and the installation of new LED lighting.
Result: Improved and safer access the light-rail transit system  for pedestrians and cyclists.

Description: Add 5 km of new pedestrian walkways and bike lanes to the Iron Horse Trail, connecting to public transit stops.
Result: Improved safety for cyclists and pedestrians when using the trail and public transit in the area.

Description: Renovate 60 bus stops with new hard surface pads, build 10 bus shelters and improvements made to 2 pedestrian crossings and 10 intersections.
Result: Increased safety and accessibility of the transit system.

Description: Install 30 new digital information displays at LRT platforms and 9 new on-board information displays. Upgrades  to the mobile payment app, as well as to 36 mobile payment validation machines and 25 point-of-sale units.
Result: Improved operation of public transit, and greater convenience for transit riders.

Description: Construct several heated bus shelters and bike storage areas at the University of Waterloo bus station.
Result: Improved passenger experience and accessibility to the transit system.

Description: Construct a biking facility  to provide a crossing at Highway 401 at Hespeler Road from the eastbound ramp to HWY 401 to the westbound ramp to HWY 401.
Result: Improved connections to Groh Avenue and to Pinebush Road, which are adjacent to numerous bus routes.

Description: Construct a new transit operations facility in the City of Welland on the same site as the current facility.
Result: Improved capacity and quality of the public transit infrastructure in Welland.

Description: Purchase a specialized accessible bus to replace the existing bus that is nearing the end of its operational life.
Result: More reliable and safer service to more remote areas of the community.

Project: GO Transit East Rail Maintenance Facility
Description: Construction of a new maintenance facility
Result: 500,000 sq. ft. space dedicated to mechanical maintenance, body repair, day-to-day cleaning; additional storage for up to 13 12-car GO Transit passenger trains.
Address: South Blair St / Victoria St E

Description: Building three new tracks on the west side of Lincolnville GO Station so that more trains can be parked there.
Result: Improved commuter service by allowing trains to be stored on the Stouffville line.

Description: Purchase 8 buses in 2020 and 8 buses in 2021, plus 3 expansion buses for a total of 19 to replace buses that have exceeded their useful life.
Result: Improved customerexperience and reliability of service.

Description: Construct 4 kms of bicycle lanes and accessible sidewalks on Grand Marais Road from  Dougall Avenue to Dominion Boulevard.
Result: Safer active transportation along Grand Marais Road.

Description: Construct 220 metres of new bike lanes and sidewalks on each side of Dougall Avenue, between Ouellette Place and Eugenie Street.
Result: Improved access to the public transit system.

Description: Construct sidewalks, bicycle lanes, multi-use trails and pedestrian bridges on existing transit routes throughout the city.
Result: Improved access to the public transit system.

Description: Improve 14 kms of sidewalk to better link Windsor residents to the transit system.
Result: Improved access to the public transit system.

Description: Install three pedestrian crossings at Drouillard Road and Richmond Street; University Avenue West and Patricia Street; and Lauzon Road and Clairview Avenue.
Result: Improved access and safety for pedestrians.

Project: Transit Terminals, New Pedestrian Bus Shelters and Customer Amenities
Description: Upgrade various components of transit stops throughout the  city, including 100 new passenger shelters and upgrading existing ones to make them more accessible, new bike facilities and new signage.
Result: Improved capacity and accessibility of the public transit system.

Description: Construct over 3 kms of designated bike lanes and sidewalks along Cabana Road West from Dougall Avenue to Rankin Avenue.
Result: Improved access to the public transit system.

Project: Implementation of the Windsor Transit Master Plan
Description: A design study to evaluate the costs of improving various aspects of the public transit system, as well as the installation of new signage and decals for the re-branding of the transit system, and new route scheduling software and an intelligent transportation system.
Result: Improved public transit system.

Description: Purchase new diesel buses, new signage of bus stops and new transit software as the expansion of a bus garage an+J44d bus storage.
Result: Improved public transit to unserved residential and industrial areas of the city.

Description: Construction of an automatic bus washing building.
Result: Improved quality of service, extended bus life cycle as well as increased efficiency and cost savings through better and quicker automaticcleaning compared to manual cleaning.

Description: Construction of dedicated rapidways along the existing Highway 7, Yonge Street and Davis Drive VIVA corridors
Result: Making it easier and faster to travel in and around York Region and to connect to transit across Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area

Description: Construct a 7.4 kilometre extension of Line 1 north from Finch Station to the Richmond Hill/Langstaff Gateway Urban Centre at Highway 7.
Result: An approximately 8 kilometre extension from Finch Station into the City of Richmond Hill
